language.name: Minhrenian
entries: It's basically the common language (other than common) people use in Minhren.

language.name: Rhen'Tsa
entries: Said to be the language of gods and was the origin/root language of Minhrenian. It is a more artistic and interruptive language and isn't fully known as those who spoke it have long since been dead but there are many who study and practice it with the records that have survived.

language.name: Talin
entries: created from the people Murkwell, it was developed as a more efficient way of writing to get as much info on on a single piece of parchment (kind of imagine kaleidoscopes and mandalas for how they look)

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Wild Rumpus lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Whatever Magicks
entries: Saanvi has better things to do than to baby her followers and teach them the mystical ways of the darkened path. Instead, she likes to expedite learning with the magick learning bonk stick. Bonk Whatever, magick! Beginning at 1st level, when you cast a warlock spell of 1st-level or higher, you can replace its damage type with a damage type from another warlock spell you know, altering the spell for this casting only.

subclassFeature.name: Play Rough
entries: Sometimes shit hits the fan and you gotta go; Saanvi has bestowed upon you the gift to, in her words, "slither away like smol sad baby snek". Beginning at 6th level, when you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to instantly teleport through the Astral Plane, causing the triggering attack to miss. You then immediately reappear in an unoccupied space of your choice within 30 feet of where you disappeared.
Once you use this reaction to evade an attack, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

Additionally, it is fun to hit things more than once; Saanvi inspires you with gremlin fervor to be either brave or foolish enough to swing twice. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can attack twice instead of once.

subclassFeature.name: Best Friends... Forever
entries: Saanvi really likes having you around as a playmate. Old people are too fragile and so are corpses so Saanvi gives you the gift of friendship forever, or at least: a very long time for you silly mortals. Starting at 10th level, you no longer require food, water, or sleep, although you still require rest to reduce exhaustion and still benefit from both short and long rests.
In addition, for every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year, and you are immune to being aged by magic.

subclassFeature.name: Snack for Saanvi
entries: Being a god is hard work; maybe as a thanks you should send Saanvi a delicious treat. Starting at 14th level, when you hit a creature with an attack, you can force them to make a Charisma saving throw in place of dealing damage. On a failed save, Saanvi's astrally projected couatl form swallows the creature whole and chews on them for up to 1 minute, or until you lose concentration on this ability.

When this feature ends, Saanvi spits them out and the banished creature returns to the space that it was previously occupying (or the nearest unoccupied space) and must make an additional Charisma saving throw, taking 5d10 force damage on a failed save, half on a success. Yum.
Once you use this feature to banish a creature you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Retribution lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.caption: Retribution Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell detect evil and good}, {@spell wrathful smite}

subclassFeature.name: Hero's Fetters
entries: I shall grant the power you seek, but with someone as powerful as you: you must be shackled and contained lest you bring unbalance to yourself and the world. But you shall find comfort in your gilded cage, my dear.

At 1st level, you feel your body change and your essence condense into a Tiny object becoming your new soul vessel and spellcasting focus for you. Because it is now forever shackled to your soul: if you die, the vessel becomes a dull and plain object.

As an action, you can enter or exit your vessel which has a 20ft radius and is 20ft high. The interior is a pleasant temperature and is adorned with a large, low table and simple yet soft pillows and cushion to sit on. Any objects left in the vessel remain there until carried out or, if the vessel is destroyed, every object stored there harmlessly appears in the unoccupied spaces closest to where the vessel formally was. You can remain inside the vessel up to the number of hours equal to twice your proficiency bonus. You cannot do this again until you finish a long rest.
If the vessel is destroyed, you receive 1d8 psychic damage. You can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron during a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Gift of Life
entries: Your life is forfeit, but that does not mean others are: use your gifts to give life to others and to heal what will be broken in you forever.
Beginning at 6th level, you gain resistance to necrotic damage. You gain the ability Lay on Hands.

subclassFeature.name: Imprisoned Sanctuary
entries: I shall grant you a short reprieve from your suffering, but it must end one way or another.
Beginning at 10th level, when you enter your vessel, you can now choose up to five willing creatures that you can see within 30 feet of you to be drawn into the vessel with you.
The creatures can stay in your vessel until you leave or the vessel is destroyed. If they stay within the vessel for at least 10 minutes, they gain the benefit of finishing a short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Fettered Gift
entries: I am here, is that what you wished for me? Make it quick, make it concise. And do not resent me for giving you exactly what you wanted.

Beginning at 14th level, you can call out to your patron to grant you a small wish. As an action, you can speak your desire to your vessel and do one of the following: You can request the effect of one spell that is 6th level or lower and have the casting time of 1 action. Or you can ask your god three questions that they will answer to their best ability. However, know that this does not come without its consequences.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish 1d4 long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Abomination lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Mark of the Beast
entries: You have heard whispers of an entity that will help you transform into what you need to become in order to gain the power you so desperately need, but no one perhaps lived to tell you what it would cost. You can feel your body change and your essence ripped apart. You are now forever marked and others know that.

At 1st level, you may shed some of your humanity and transform into a Monstrous Form for 1 minute as a bonus action. You can transform a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You also have immunity to the Frightened condition.

Whenever a creature makes a direct attack to you in this form, it must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a fail, the creature must choose a new target. On a success, that creature is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Horrid Wings
entries: I shall free you of your shackles and grant you the power to touch the stars themselves.

Beginning at 6th level, as a bonus action, you feel your bones crack and transform and you sprout bat-like wings from your back: giving yourself a flying speed of 30 feet that lasts for 10 minutes during which you can hover. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

In addition, once during each of your  turns, when you hit a creatures an attack and roll damage against the creature, you can replace that damage type with necrotic damage. In your Monstrous Form, you can roll one additional damage die of necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Beast of Shadows
entries: What have you become? Even the shadows shirk in fear of you or rather: what is left of you.
Beginning at 10th level, dark powers from your patron now saturates your body. You find that you no longer need to eat, drink, or breathe yet there is a hunger that persists.
You are resistant to Radiant damage and immune to it when you are in your Monstrous Form.

In addition, when you are reduced to 0 hit points, you may use your reaction to drop to 1 hit point instead. Your body bubbles and erupts with vengeful fury. Each creature within 30 ft of you must make a Dexterity saving throw and receive 2d10 + your warlock level of necrotic damage on a fail or half of that on a success. Once you use this reaction, you cannot do so again until you finish 1d4 long rests.

subclassFeature.name: Agonized Abomination
entries: Vengeance is a sickening disease isn't it? What a wretched soul you are, but you're still a beautiful abomination.
Beginning at 14th level, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage in your Monstrous Form.

Additionally, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d8 + your warlock level. Additionally, if you put a severed body part of yours back in place and use this feature; you see that your flesh stitches itself together. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Madness lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Awoken Eye
entries: Those brave or foolish enough to offer their service are first rewarded with a painful transformation of an eye protruding from a lesion that suddenly bursts open on the body; usually the palm, shoulder, or thigh. Many do not survive this first trial.

Beginning at 1st level, you gain darkvision with a range of 30 feet. You also gain a bonus that is equal to your Wisdom modifier to your Passive Perception (Wisdom) score and to your Perception Checks (Wisdom).
In addition, you can also do 1d6 damage to yourself and have the eye shut and crawl across your flesh. Doing so lets you cast Cause Fear for free once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: True Form
entries: So, you survived the first experiment...How interesting. Well, now to unlock your true potential by casting aside the flesh that binds you to weakness. Here is your blade, show me your fidelity to the Truth and to me.
Beginning at 6th level, you have discarded what they deem unnecessary and your patron's dark magick has wormed and festered in your body and soul. You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
In addition, when you hit a creature with an attack and roll damage, you may replace the damage type with necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Maddening Enlightenment
entries: Now you will truly see my divine plan...isn't it wonderful? Isn't it horrifying. Do not turn away from it! Embrace it!
Beginning at 10th level, you gain advantage on death saving throws, immunity to being frightened, and resistance to necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Deranged Disciple
entries: You are now complete. Now go and share the Truth to the rest of the blinded fools who avert their gaze from my glory. You have finally received the approval of your dark patron and grant you a sliver of their madness and power.
Beginning at 14th level, you can cast Finger of Death once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Hedonistic Domain
entries: Why live dully when you can live deliciously? Pleasure can bring insight and wisdom to ourselves and others. For our true nature is that of desire, lust, and passion. There are many who follow in the footsteps of Zephyr one way or another. But very few dedicate their life entirely to the hedonistic lifestyle and even fewer who impress Zephyr that he brings them under his rapturous light. Those touches by him find that their senses for pain and pleasure are heightened because one cannot live without the other. Clerics of the Hedonistic Domaine are usually entertainers but ultimately those who seek pleasure in all forms. They are usually within the Chaotic Neutral alignment as seeking their whims presides any other worldly and earthly concerns.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: {@i 1st-level Hedonistic Domain feature}
You gain proficiency with Heavy Armor and musical instruments

subclassFeature.name: Way to Euphoria
entries: {@i 1st-level Hedonistic Domain feature}

Starting at 1st level, you create a frenzy of euphoria that emboldens and inspires your allies for 10 minutes or until you use it again. As an action, you choose a number of willing creatures within 30 feet of you (this can include yourself) equal to your proficiency bonus. While within 30 feet of you, they can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw it makes. Each creature can add the d4 no more than once per turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Domain Spells
entries: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Hedonistic Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Way to Passion
entries: {@i 2nd-level Hedonistic Domain feature}
Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to sing the songs of the gods, invoking their powers.

You may  stir the muses within you and channel the divine songs that weave the weft of magic together that only the gods know. You may choose one of the songs listed below. As you travel, you may encounter other gods who will perhaps grant teach you their songs:
{@b Alaesia's Lullaby:} You and friendly creatures who can hear or see your performance within 30 feet regain 1d6 temporary hit points (they roll).
The die increases to 1d8 at 9th level, 1d10 at 13th level, and 1d12 at 17th level.
{@b Glasha's War Chant:} Any creature of your choice that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must succeed a Wisdom saving throw against your DC or become Frightened until your next turn.

{@b Kamant's Idle Tune:} You are able to create one Medium or Small nonmagical item of your choice in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of you. The GP value cannot be more than 20 times your level. The item disappears after a number of hours equal to your proficiency bonus.
The size of the item you can create with this feature increases by one size category when you reach 6th level (Large) and 14th level (Huge).

subclassFeature.name: Way to Rapture
entries: {@i 6th-level Hedonistic Domain feature}
Beginning at 6th level, your euphoric frenzy grows in power with the bonus die increasing to a {@dice 1d6} when you use Way of Euphoria.

Furthermore, you may use this ability during your turn as an action during combat. If you do so, until your next turn or you are incapacitated, all allies and you within 30 feet that can hear your performance have advantage on Saving Throws against being frightened or charmed.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: {@i 8th-level Hedonistic Domain feature}
You add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Way to Paradise
entries: {@i 17th-level Hedonistic Domain feature}
At 17th level, your frenzy has reached its crescendo. The benefits of your Way to Euphoria and Way to Rapture features now work when the creatures are within 60 feet of each other.
Furthermore, you can end Charmed or Frightened conditions at a time to allies as your Bonus Action on your turn.
